decks.notes: The key concept of this deck is to aggressively control the board and apply pressure with a combination of efficient removal spells and powerful creatures. The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Thoughtseize and Hero's Downfall, while also generating value with cards like Abzan Charm and Courser of Kruphix. The deck's finishers, Siege Rhino and Elspeth, Sun's Champion, allow for a strong endgame presence and can quickly close out the game. The deck also includes a small amount of card draw and mana fixing to ensure consistency and maximize its aggressive potential.

The main focus of this Golgari Aggro deck is to quickly build up a strong board presence with efficient creatures like Elvish Mystic, Courser of Kruphix, and Hornet Queen. The deck also utilizes key enchantments like Whip of Erebos and Eidolon of Blossoms to generate card advantage and gain life. Removal spells such as Murderous Cut and Hero's Downfall help control the opponent's board while Thoughtseize disrupts their game plan. The deck's mana base includes Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx and Temple of Malady to ensure consistent mana production for aggressive plays.

The main concept of this Jeskai Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively attack the opponent using a combination of cheap creatures and burn spells. The key cards in this strategy are Jeskai Ascendancy, which provides additional prowess triggers and card draw, and Treasure Cruise, which helps refill the hand with cheap spells. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a constant stream of threats and direct damage, while also having a bit of card advantage and flexibility through cards like Jeskai Charm and Chandra, Pyromaster.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay by utilizing a mix of powerful creatures like Siege Rhino and Courser of Kruphix, supported by removal and card draw spells such as Hero's Downfall and Thoughtseize. The mana base is designed to provide consistent access to the necessary colors for casting spells. The deck includes key threats like Sorin, Solemn Visitor and Elspeth, Sun's Champion to further pressure opponents and close out games quickly. The goal is to establish board presence early and maintain pressure throughout the game to secure a victory.

This Abzan Aggro deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures like Siege Rhino and Wingmate Roc to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. It also includes versatile removal spells like Hero's Downfall and Abzan Charm to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to maintain a strong board presence while applying pressure to the opponent's life total, with support from planeswalkers like Elspeth, Sun's Champion and Sorin, Solemn Visitor to help close out the game. Additionally, cards like Thoughtseize are included to disrupt the opponent's hand and prevent them from establishing their game plan.

The deck is focused on playing aggressive creatures and using powerful removal spells to control the board while maintaining card advantage with cards like Courser of Kruphix and Abzan Charm. The deck aims to quickly put pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures like Siege Rhino and Brimaz, King of Oreskos, while also having access to powerful planeswalkers like Elspeth, Sun's Champion and Sorin, Solemn Visitor for additional threats and value. By combining aggression and card advantage, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on quickly playing aggressive creatures like Siege Rhino and Wingmate Roc to deal damage to the opponent while also gaining value from cards like Courser of Kruphix and Hornet Queen. The deck also utilizes cards like Soul of Theros and Whip of Erebos to provide additional threats and lifegain. Additionally, the deck includes removal spells like Hero's Downfall and Murderous Cut to deal with opposing threats. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early on and maintain board presence to secure victory.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with cheap creatures and burn spells. The goal is to establish early board presence with cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Seeker of the Way, while also dealing direct damage with Lightning Strike and Stoke the Flames. Chandra, Pyromaster provides card advantage and extra burn, while Eidolon of Countless Battles and Wingmate Roc offer powerful finishers. Chained to the Rocks handles larger threats, and Raise the Alarm and Hordeling Outburst provide additional creature support. The deck aims to close out the game swiftly before the opponent can stabilize.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on filling the graveyard with creature cards to fuel the Whip of Erebos and utilize its abilities to gain life and bring back creatures from the graveyard. The deck also includes cards like Hornet Queen and Doomwake Giant to generate creature tokens and disrupt the opponent's board. The deck features a mix of removal spells, ramp creatures like Elvish Mystic, and card draw engines like Eidolon of Blossoms to maintain control and apply pressure on the opponent. The mana base includes Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx for ramp and Temple of Malady for scrying.

This deck focuses on using aggressive creatures like Hornet Queen, Doomwake Giant, and Eidolon of Blossoms to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes powerful removal spells like Hero's Downfall and Thoughtseize to control the board. Whip of Erebos provides lifelink and recursion. Additionally, cards like Pharika, God of Affliction and Commune with the Gods help with graveyard shenanigans. The mana base is designed to support the deck's Golgari color identity, with lands like Temple of Malady and Llanowar Wastes providing the necessary fixing.

The main concept of this Jeskai Control deck is centered around utilizing a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and card draw to control the board and outvalue the opponent. It aims to stall out the game with cards like Banishing Light and Anger of the Gods, while also generating card advantage through Dig Through Time and Jace's Ingenuity. Jeskai Ascendancy provides an additional win condition, with creatures like Prognostic Sphinx and Pearl Lake Ancient acting as threats. The deck focuses on efficiently controlling the game and ultimately overwhelming the opponent with powerful spells.

This Mardu Control deck focuses on removal, disruption, and powerful threats to control the opponent's board and win the game. With a mix of burn spells, creature removal, and powerful creatures like Butcher of the Horde and Goblin Rabblemaster, the deck aims to maintain control of the game while putting pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Sarkhan, the Dragonspeaker and Elspeth, Sun's Champion provide additional threats and value. With a balanced mix of removal, threats, and card advantage, this deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver its opponent for victory.

The focus of this Red Deck Wins deck is to quickly build a board presence and deal damage to the opponent as fast as possible. By utilizing low-cost and efficient burn spells like Lightning Strike and Stoke the Flames, as well as aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Goblin Rabblemaster, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize. Cards like Foundry Street Denizen and Hordeling Outburst help to build a wide board, while spells like Titan's Strength and Magma Jet provide additional reach and removal options.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly build up a board presence with aggressive creatures like Sidisi, Brood Tyrant and Courser of Kruphix, while also controlling the opponent's board with removal spells like Murderous Cut and Hero's Downfall. The deck also has a graveyard recursion theme with cards like Soul of Innistrad and Whip of Erebos. By utilizing a mix of creatures, removal, and graveyard interactions, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory through a combination of aggressive attacks and powerful abilities.

The main concept of this deck is to use a combination of powerful creatures like Sidisi, Brood Tyrant and Hornet Queen, along with removal spells like Murderous Cut and Hero's Downfall, to put pressure on the opponent and control the board. The deck also utilizes cards like Courser of Kruphix and Sylvan Caryatid to ramp up mana and fix the colors, while using cards like Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's strategy. This allows the deck to maintain a fast and aggressive tempo while generating value from cards like Ashiok, Nightmare Weaver and Whip of Erebos.

This deck focuses on generating early game pressure and disruption through cheap removal spells like Hero's Downfall and Thoughtseize, while also ramping up with mana acceleration cards like Sylvan Caryatid and Courser of Kruphix. The strategy revolves around utilizing creatures like Sidisi, Brood Tyrant and Hornet Queen to overwhelm the opponent, with the ability to gain life and recur key threats using cards like Whip of Erebos. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Doomwake Giant and Soul of Innistrad to close out games quickly.

The key focus of this deck is to control the board through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption. By utilizing cards like Dissolve, Hero's Downfall, and Thoughtseize, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while digging for key spells with cards like Dig Through Time and Jace's Ingenuity. The inclusion of cards like Perilous Vault and Pearl Lake Ancient provides additional board control options, while the mana base allows for flexibility and consistency in casting spells. Overall, the deck's strategy revolves around maintaining control of the game until it can secure a victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing efficient threats and disruption spells to pressure the opponent early while maintaining card advantage through cards like Sidisi, Brood Tyrant and Courser of Kruphix. By disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Hero's Downfall, the deck aims to create a window of opportunity to land powerful threats such as Hornet Queen and Soul of Innistrad to close out the game. The inclusion of the Whip of Erebos provides additional reach and life gain to grind out longer games. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three-color strategy efficiently.

This Aggro deck focuses on playing efficient creatures like Siege Rhino, Courser of Kruphix, and Brimaz, King of Oreskos early on to pressure the opponent. It also utilizes cards like Thoughtseize and Abzan Charm to disrupt the opponent's game plan while providing valuable removal. The deck has a strong midgame with cards like Wingmate Roc and Elspeth, Sun's Champion to close out games quickly. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three-color combination while still allowing for consistent plays throughout the game.

The deck revolves around the combo of Jeskai Ascendancy, Retraction Helix, and mana dorks like Kiora's Follower and Rattleclaw Mystic to generate infinite mana and card draw. By casting spells and untapping creatures repeatedly, the deck aims to win by milling the opponent with Altar of the Brood or dealing lethal damage with a massive Astral Cornucopia. Dig Through Time and Commune with the Gods help to find the combo pieces, while Twinflame can create additional copies of key creatures. Overall, the deck focuses on quickly assembling its combo pieces and overwhelming the opponent with a powerful synergy of cards.

This deck is focused on quickly dealing damage to the opponent using a combination of low-cost, aggressive creatures and burn spells. By efficiently getting creatures onto the battlefield and using direct damage spells to clear the way or finish off the opponent, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. With a majority of the cards focused on dealing damage directly to the opponent or their creatures, this deck is designed to be fast-paced and relentless in its assault.

The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with a mix of creatures and removal spells. It utilizes the Sultai color combination to have a versatile and powerful lineup. The main strategy is to ramp up mana with cards like Sylvan Caryatid and Courser of Kruphix, while disrupting the opponent's hand with Thoughtseize. The deck can apply pressure with creatures like Sidisi, Brood Tyrant and Hornet Queen, and also has options for dealing with threats through removal spells like Hero's Downfall and Murderous Cut. Whip of Erebos provides additional value by bringing creatures back from the graveyard.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal spells, and card draw, using Dimir colors. It aims to keep the opponent's threats in check while setting up its own win condition, such as with Pearl Lake Ancient. The deck includes a mix of cheap removal like Bile Blight and Hero's Downfall, along with versatile counterspells like Dissolve. Card advantage is gained through spells like Jace's Ingenuity and Dig Through Time. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures and use Whip of Erebos to bring them back onto the battlefield. The deck also focuses on control elements with cards like Hero's Downfall and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The creatures in the deck provide value with abilities like generating tokens (Sidisi, Brood Tyrant), card advantage (Courser of Kruphix), and board presence (Hornet Queen). The inclusion of Ashiok, Nightmare Weaver adds another disruptive element by exiling cards from the opponent's deck.
